ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: The Future of WCF is indeed RESTful
ygData.msgSnippet: I know what @type means in html, I m suggesting what it could mean. Let s pretend I called it @foobar or @accept if it bothers you that much. Cheers, Mike

I know what @type means in html, I'm suggesting what it could mean.

Let's =
pretend I called it @foobar or @accept if it bothers you that much.

Cheers=
,
Mike

.net> wrote:

ed they

rence in

> -Eric

> Mik=
e Kelly wrote:
>
>> On Fri, Oct 22, 2010 at 1:30 AM, Eric J. Bowman
>> <eri=
c@...> wrote:
>> > The problem with Accept-based conneg,
>> > =
is that you don't always have control over the client -- i.e. you
>> > can'=
t tell a browser to negotiate between Atom and JSON without
>> > Code on De=
mand. =A0So there needs to be some way to link directly to
>> > the desired=
 variant, without conneg.
>>
>> .. or hyperlinks that can indicate circumst=
antial negotiation
>> preferences?
>>
>> e.g. Browsers could over-ride thei=
r default headers for the following
>> link:
>>
>> <a type=3D"application/j=
son" href=3D"/foo">
>>
>> thus addressing the need you've outlined without =
being forced to treat
>> representations as resources or use code on demand=
.
